description: From the earlier form macle, from macule, which see for more.

verbs.description: mackle (third-person singular simple present mackles, present participle mackling, simple past and past participle mackled)
mackle (third-person singular simple present mackles, present participle mackling, simple past and past participle mackled)

entries.meaning: (UK, dialect, transitive) To assemble in a makeshift manner; to cobble together.
examples: It's dry and warm and if Jacob and I were to put our heads together I'm sure we could find something in the tack-room, some harness, or a nose band or two that could be mackled together to make a carrying contraption.
